job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Fargo, ND
pros: Direct-care staff are focused on patient care, high expectations are set for care standards, training is not always enough for new staff but it is a longer training period than at many other places. You will learn so much and you'll learn to do it the right way - usually. So much experience with PICC lines, IV starts, blood draws, wound care, end of life care, CHF management, and numerous other skills. Lots of practice communicating with PCPs and advocating for patients, and often PCPs are happy to volunteer information about why they are ordering something, or what certain labs might indicate alongside symptoms. Student loan repayment up to 200/month, recently increased wages to be competitive with job market. Flexibility while attending school.
cons: Upper management is toxic. Behavior of the SERC are either not taken seriously, or the complaints never reach the board/ceo, or they sanction her behavior. Countless unit managers, directors of nursing, excellent charge nurses, quality aides, and great long time employees of depts across the spectrum have left due to her treatment of staff. She is well-known to verbally berate staff, reacts with hostility if a question or concern is brought forward, is rarely up on the units and if she is she doesn't interact with residents and will ignore all the good work being done and the achievements of direct care staff, instead she will focus on things like whether signs are laminated or a TV not yet turned off or some other insignificant thing that she can micro manage and reduce staff morale.
